article.name: FortiGate Cloud Integration Guide for SecurityCoach
article.title: FortiGate Cloud Integration Guide for SecurityCoach
article.body:
In this article, you will learn how to integrate ForitGate Cloud with SecurityCoach. Once the integration is complete, data provided by FortiGate Cloud will be available under the SecurityCoach tab of your KnowBe4 console. This data can be viewed in SecurityCoach reports and used to create real-time coaching campaigns. For general information about SecurityCoach, see our SecurityCoach Product Manual.

Prerequisites

Before you integrate Fortigate Cloud with SecurityCoach, make sure that your FortiGate device is capable of disk logging and has disk logging enabled. For some low-end FortiGate devices, disk logging is unavailable. For more information, see Fortinet’s How to configure logging in disk using GUI/CLI article.

To verify if your FortiGate device has disk logging enabled, follow these steps:

  1. Log in to your FortiGate Cloud Virtual Machine console.
  2. Navigate to Log & Report > Log Settings > Local Logs.
  3. Verify that the Disk logging setting has Enable selected.

    Important:If no Disk logging configuration is available, your device might not support disk logging.
  4. Click Apply at the bottom of the screen.

Verify User Group Setup in FortiGate Virtual Machine

Before you can configure this integration, you’ll need to verify or add a user group to FortiGate’s Outbound Traffic policy. To do this, follow the steps below.

Note: Before you can set up the integration, you’ll need to ensure that the configuration management is enabled, the management tunnel is online, and that you have a FortiGate Cloud admin account.
  1. Log in to your FortiGate Cloud Virtual Machine console.
  2. Navigate to Policy & Objects > Firewall Policy.
  3. Click Outbound traffic. 
  4. On the page that appears, verify that your firewall user group is selected in the Source field. If your group isn’t selected, add them.
  5. Click OK.

Set Up the Integration in FortiGate Cloud

Follow the steps below to set up this integration in your FortiGate Cloud account.

  1. Log in to your FortiCloud IAM account.
  2. From the navigation menu on the left side of the page, select Permission Profiles.
  3. Click Add New.
  4. In the New Portal Permission Profile, fill out the Permission Profile Name and Status fields. Then, click Add Portal.
  5. Select FortiGate Cloud, then click Add.
  6. In the Permission Profile section, select Read Only for all the permissions.
  7. In the top-right corner of the page, click Submit.
  8. From the navigation menu on the left side of the page, select Users.
  9. Click Add New > API User.
  10. On the Add API User page, select the permission profile you just created from the Select a Permission Profile drop-down menu. Then, click Next.
  11. Verify the information is correct, then click Next.
  12. Click Download Credentials.
  13. In the Security Check pop-up window, enter a secure password to encrypt your file. Then, click Proceed.
  14. Open the file you just downloaded, then enter the password you just created.
  15. The text file will contain an API ID and an API Password. Copy the ID and password and save them to a secure location so that you can easily access them for later steps in the configuration process.
  16. Log in to your FortiGate Cloud portal.
  17. On the top-right corner of the page, you’ll see the Region drop-down menu.
  18. Based on the region in the drop-down menu, use the table below to identify the API domain name. You’ll need to enter this domain name in the next section.
    Region Name API Domain
    Global

    api.fortigate.forticloud.com
    US

    usapi.fortigate.forticloud.com
    EU

    euapi.fortigate.forticloud.com
    Japan

    jpapi.fortigate.forticloud.com

Set Up the Integration in Your KnowBe4 Console

To register FortiGate Cloud with SecurityCoach in your KnowBe4 console, follow the steps below.

  1. Log in to your KnowBe4 console and navigate to SecurityCoach > Setup > Security Vendor Integrations.
  2. Locate the FortiGate Cloud card and click Configure.
  3. Enter the API Domain, API ID, and API Password that you saved in the previous section of this article.
  4. Click Connect.
Note:FortiGate Cloud’s events are automatically mapped to users using their email address.

images.alt:
The image is a screenshot of the Fortinet management interface (v7.4.4), displaying the **Log Settings** configuration page, which is highlighted under the **Log & Report** navigation menu.

The main content panel is open to the **Local Logs** tab.

**Configuration Settings:**
*   **Disk logging:** Currently set to **Enable** (active).
*   **Local reports:** Disabled (toggle switch in the off position).
*   **Historical FortiView:** Disabled (toggle switch in the off position).

**Disk Usage Section:**
The interface shows a donut chart representing the total available storage, labeled **22.05 GiB** (Total).
*   **Free space:** 22.05 GiB
*   **Used space:** 1 MiB

**Log Retention Policy:**
An informational box states: "Logs older than 7 day(s) are deleted from the disk."

**Historical Disk Usage:**
A time-series area chart displays past disk utilization, with the Y-axis scaled in KiB (e.g., 585.94 KiB to 976.56 KiB).

The bottom of the configuration panel contains a green **Apply** button to save changes.
images.context:
to Log & Report > Log Settings > Local Logs.
Verify that the Disk logging setting has Enable selecte

images.alt:
The UI displays the active **Firewall Policy** configuration view within a network security management interface.

**Navigation Pane:**
The left navigation pane is focused on the **Policy & Objects** category, with the sub-menu item **Firewall Policy** selected and highlighted (green box). This item is marked with a star icon, indicating it may be bookmarked. Other visible menu options include **IPv4 DoS Policy**, **Addresses**, and **Services**.

**Main Content Area (Policy List):**
The top toolbar contains action buttons: **+ Create new**, **Policy match** (search function), and **Search**.

The policy table structure shows interface mapping above the columns (**port1 → port1**). Primary columns visible are **ID**, **Name**, **Source**, and **Destination**.

1.  **Explicit Policy:** Row 1 has ID **1** and is named **Outbound traffic**. The source includes **Fortigate\_User\_Group** (user icon) and **all** (IPv4 icon). The destination is also defined as **all** (IPv4 icon). An orange arrow explicitly highlights the "Outbound traffic" name field, suggesting an interaction point.
2.  **Implicit Policy:** A section labeled **Implicit (1)** contains Row 2, which has ID **0** and the name **Implicit Deny**. This policy also defines both Source and Destination as **all** (IPv4 icon).
images.context:
og in to your FortiGate Cloud Virtual Machine console.
Navigate to Policy & Objects > Firewall Polic

images.alt:
This image displays a configuration panel for a firewall or security policy, organized into various parameters.

**General Policy Parameters:**

*   **Name:** Set to "Outbound traffic."
*   **Incoming interface:** Set to "port1" (indicated by a network interface icon).
*   **Outgoing interface:** Set to "port1" (indicated by a network interface icon).

**Source Definition (Highlighted Area):**

The **Source** field, which specifies allowed origins for the traffic, contains two defined objects, both with removal ('X') icons and an addition (+) button below:

1.  A User Group object (indicated by a multi-user icon): **Fortigate\_User\_Group**.
2.  A Network/IP Address object (indicated by a network/IP icon): **all**.

**Traffic and Action Parameters:**

*   **Destination:** Set to the Network object **all**.
*   **Schedule:** Set to **always**.
*   **Service:** Set to **ALL** (with a computer icon).
*   **Action:** Set to **ACCEPT** (Green highlighted checkbox).
*   **Inspection mode:** Set to **Proxy-based** (Green highlighted toggle); Flow-based is the alternative option.

**Firewall/Network Options:**

*   **NAT:** Enabled (Green toggle switch).
*   **IP pool configuration:** Set to **Use Outgoing Interface Address** (Green highlighted button); Use Dynamic IP Pool is the alternative.
*   **Preserve source port:** Disabled (Off toggle switch).
*   **Protocol options:** Set to **default**.

The panel concludes with the header "Security Profiles" and standard confirmation buttons: **OK** (Green primary button) and **Cancel**.
images.context: If your group isn’t selected, add them.

images.alt:
This image displays the **FortiCloud Identity and Access Management (IAM)** dashboard, focused on the **Permission Profiles** management screen.

**UI Context and Navigation:**
*   The primary navigation sidebar, labeled **I A M**, highlights the currently active link: **Permission Profiles**.
*   The breadcrumb path confirms the location: `/ Permission Profiles`.
*   The section title is **Permission Profiles**.

**Controls and Actions:**
*   A search input field is present for filtering profiles.
*   Administrative buttons include **Disable** and **Delete** (both appear inactive/greyed out).
*   The primary action button, highlighted by an orange arrow, is the active blue button labeled **Add New**, used for creating a new permission profile.

**Data Display:**
*   The page displays a list of profiles under the heading **Total Records 5**.
*   The table includes checkboxes for row selection and the following sortable column headers: **Profile Name**, **Profile Description**, **Type**, **\# of Accessible Portals**, **Created On**, and **Status**. (Note: The actual data in the rows is obscured.)

The image displays a user interface screen for defining a new security configuration, titled **"New Portal Permission Profile."**

**Context and Navigation:**
*   The breadcrumb trail indicates the location: `/ Permission Profiles / New Portal Permission Profile`.
*   Global action buttons are located in the top right: **"Cancel"** (light button) and **"Submit"** (primary blue button).

**Form Sections and Elements:**

1.  **BASIC INFO** (Section Header)
    *   **Permission Profile Name:** Required text input field (marked by an asterisk).
    *   **Status:** Required dropdown field (marked by an asterisk), currently displaying the selected value **"Active."**
    *   **Description:** Standard text input field, showing the placeholder text *Enter Permission Profile Description*.

2.  **PERMISSION PROFILE** (Section Header)
    *   An action button labeled **"Add Portal"** is present on the right, indicating the next step in configuring permissions by linking a specific portal. This button includes an icon resembling a portal or chain link.

This image displays a UI panel titled **"Add These Portals To My Accounts,"** designed for selecting multiple services to associate with a user's account.

**UI Layout and Elements:**

1.  **Portal Selection Grid:** The central feature is a multi-column list containing approximately 40 services, primarily Fortinet products (e.g., FortiManager Cloud, FortiSASE, FortiSandbox Cloud). Each service name is accompanied by an unchecked square checkbox, indicating selection status.
2.  **Selection Status:**
    *   The text **"Total Selected 1"** is displayed above the list, accompanied by an information icon.
    *   The service **"FortiGate Cloud"** is marked with a blue checkmark, indicating it is the single currently selected item.
3.  **Global Control:** A toggle switch labeled **"Select All"** is positioned in the upper right corner, allowing for bulk selection.
4.  **Action Buttons:** The bottom of the panel contains two final action controls:
    *   **"Cancel"** (plain text, secondary action) on the left.
    *   **"Add"** (blue button, primary action) on the right. An orange arrow highlights the "Add" button, indicating the expected user workflow submission.

This image displays a User Interface (UI) page for creating a new permission profile, titled **"New Portal Permission Profile."**

**Header Elements:**
*   Navigation breadcrumb: `/ Permission Profiles / New Portal Permission Profile`.
*   Action buttons in the top right corner: **Cancel** and a primary blue **Submit** button.

**Section 1: BASIC INFO**
This section contains standard form fields:
*   **Permission Profile Name:** Text input field (required, indicated by an asterisk).
*   **Status:** Dropdown menu, currently set to **Active**.
*   **Description:** Multi-line text area with placeholder text: *Enter Permission Profile Description*.

**Section 2: PERMISSION PROFILE**
This section defines resource access levels.
*   An **Add Portal** button is located in the upper right of this section.
*   A subsection dedicated to **FortiGate Cloud** access is displayed in a table-like format.
    *   Resources listed include: **Configuration Management**, **Logging and Reporting**, **Cloud Sandbox**, and **IOC** (each accompanied by an information icon).
    *   Permission levels are selectable via radio buttons, categorized as **Read Only**, **Read & Write**, and **No Access**.
    *   **All listed resources are currently configured to "Read Only"**, indicated by the selected (blue) radio buttons in that column.
*   A trash can icon (Delete) is available above the permission grid, next to the "FortiGate Cloud" title, indicating the portal or permission set can be removed.
images.context: ection, select Read Only for all the permissions.

images.alt:
This image is a screenshot of the **FortiCloud Identity and Access Management (IAM)** web interface, specifically on the **Users** management page.

**UI Context and Navigation:**

*   **Header:** Displays the **FortiCloud** logo and name, along with top navigation elements like **Services** and **Support**.
*   **Sidebar Navigation (Left):** Currently shows the IAM section. The **Users** menu item is highlighted in orange, indicating the active page. Below it is **User Groups**.
*   **Breadcrumb:** `/ Users`
*   **Page Title:** **Users** (with an adjacent information icon).

**Main Content Area:**

*   **Search Bar:** An input field labeled **Search...** with a magnifying glass icon for executing the search.
*   **Action Button:** A prominent blue button labeled **Add New** with a dropdown arrow.
    *   **Dropdown Menu:** Clicking or hovering over the dropdown arrow reveals two options: **IAM User** and **API User**.
    *   **Focus Indication:** An orange arrow points toward the dropdown menu, specifically highlighting the **API User** option.
*   **Table Metadata:** Displays **Total Records** followed by a count (partially obscured, showing a blue "6").
*   **Table Headers (Partial View):** Shows fragments of column headers, including **USERNAME ROLE ID...** and **DESCRIPTION**.

The image displays the first step, **"1. API User Details,"** of the **"Add API User"** workflow, as indicated by the active step indicator and the breadcrumb trail (`Home / Users / New API User`).

**UI Context:** The workflow involves three steps: 1. Add API User, 2. Confirmation, and 3. Completion.

**Form Elements:**

1.  **API User Details Section:**
    *   A text input field labeled **"Description:"** contains the value **"KB4 Integration."**
2.  **Permission Profile Section (Highlighted):**
    *   This section is titled **"PERMISSION PROFILE."**
    *   A required dropdown selection field is labeled **"Select a Permission Profile. \*"**
    *   The current selection is **"None,"** and the field is actively expanded, showing a list of blurred permission profile options below.

**Action Bar:**
The footer contains navigational controls:
*   A **"Cancel"** link (left aligned).
*   A primary blue button labeled **"Next"** (right aligned), which is the designated progression action for this step (visually emphasized by an orange arrow).

This image captures Step 1 of a multi-step workflow titled "Add API User."

**Header and Navigation:**
*   The title bar displays "Add API User."
*   A breadcrumb navigation shows the path: Home icon / Users / New API User.
*   A step indicator shows the current process: **1. Add API User** (Active), 2. Confirmation (Inactive), 3. Completion (Inactive).

**Form Section: 1. API User Details**

**API User Details:**
*   **Description:** An input field contains the text "KB4 Integration."

**Permission Profile:**
*   **Select a Permission Profile:** A required dropdown menu (indicated by an asterisk) has a preselected, obscured value.

**Permission Details:**
This section displays a breakdown of permissions associated with the selected profile, organized into two columns:

1.  **FortiAnalyzer Cloud:**
    *   **Access:** Checked (blue checkmark).
    *   **Access Type:** ReadOnly.
    *   **Additional Permission:** Empty.

2.  **FortiGate Cloud:**
    *   **Resources** (listed vertically): Configuration Management (with info icon), Logging and Reporting (with info icon), Cloud Sandbox (with info icon), IOC (with info icon).
    *   **Read Only** column: Checked for all four listed resources.
    *   **Read & Write** column: Empty (no access checks).
    *   **No Access** column: Empty (no access checks).

**Action Bar:**
*   Located at the bottom left: "Cancel" (text link).
*   Located at the bottom right: A blue button labeled "Next."
*   An orange arrow overlay points toward the "Next" button.
images.context: information is correct, then click Next.

images.alt:
This screenshot displays the "API User Information" page within a cloud management portal interface. The purpose of this page is to review and manage details and permissions associated with a specific API user.

### UI Structure and Alerts

*   **Page Title:** "API User Information."
*   **Success Banner:** A green notification banner is present at the top, stating: "SUCCESS! The requested data has been updated."
*   **Action Button (Header):** A primary blue button labeled "Edit" is located in the upper right corner.

### API User and Profile Details

The content is organized into three sections using capitalized blue headers:

1.  **API USER DETAILS:** Displays fundamental account parameters:
    *   API User ID (Value blurred).
    *   Status (Value: Active).
    *   Updated (Date blurred).
    *   Description (Text blurred).
2.  **PERMISSION PROFILE:** Displays the assigned profile name:
    *   Profile Name (Value blurred).

### Permission Details

The "PERMISSION DETAILS" section provides a table view of access rights across different cloud services:

*   **FortiAnalyzer Cloud:** Shows granted access with "ReadOnly" access type.
*   **FortiGate Cloud:** Uses a matrix format with columns for "Read Only," "Read & Write," and "No Access."
    *   The following resources are listed, all assigned **Read & Write** permissions (indicated by checkmarks):
        *   Configuration Management
        *   Logging and Reporting
        *   Cloud Sandbox
        *   IOC

### Footer and Critical Action

A dedicated footer section contains a critical warning and the primary action button:

*   **Warning Text:** A prominent blue warning states: "IMPORTANT: Downloading API User Credentials will reset the Users security credentials each time you perform this action."
*   **Action Button (Footer):** A blue button labeled "Download Credentials" is available for generating new API security keys.

This image displays a security verification screen requiring user input.

**Context and Text Elements:**

*   **Title:** "Security Check" (Displayed in blue, large font).
*   **Instructional Text:** "We are keeping your info safe. To prevent fraud, please input a password for your credential file protection."
*   **Input Label:** "PASSWORD" (Bold, uppercase text).

**UI Elements:**

*   **Password Input Field:** A horizontal input box is provided below the label. It features a prepended padlock icon (security symbol). The field is populated with masked input (represented by a series of black dots).
*   **Action Link:** A grey text link labeled "Cancel" is positioned near the bottom left.
*   **Primary Action Button:** A rectangular, blue button labeled "Proceed" is positioned in the bottom right corner.

**Annotation:**

*   An intrusive orange directional arrow is overlaid on the image, pointing from the center toward the "Proceed" button, indicating the required next step.

This image displays a configuration input section, likely from a code editor or terminal interface, detailing required authentication credentials.

**UI Elements and Context:**
The interface features black text on a white background (inverted from typical terminal display in the rendering), presenting configuration variables. Two distinct input fields are visible, highlighted by light gray rectangular background elements, indicating areas where values must be supplied or have been redacted. These two fields are contained within a temporary orange boundary for emphasis.

**Text and Labels (Top to Bottom):**

1.  **Label 1:** `apiId:` (A field requesting an Application Programming Interface Identifier.)
2.  **Label 2:** `password:` (A field requesting the corresponding password or secret.)
3.  **Static Configuration:** `clientId for FortiGate Cloud: fortigatecloud` (This line provides the default or required client ID value, explicitly referencing the FortiGate Cloud service.)

**Visual Annotations:**
Several words throughout the displayed text (including `password`, `clientId`, `FortiGate`, and `fortigatecloud`) are marked with a red dotted underline, typically signifying spelling errors, syntax warnings, or unrecognized terms within the context of the editing environment.
images.context: n easily access them for later steps in the configuration process.

images.alt:
This image displays the **Assets** dashboard within the **FortiGateCloud** web interface, presenting summary metrics via doughnut charts.

**Header and Navigation:**
*   **Application Header (Blue Bar):** Contains the logo "FortiGateCloud" and primary navigation links: **Services** (Dropdown) and **Support** (Dropdown).
*   **User/Context Bar (Top Right):** Shows the selected region as **Region: global** (with a dropdown), followed by icons for a view switcher, dark mode toggle, notifications/alerts (bell), help (question mark), and the logged-in user identifier (**ana**...).
*   **Sidebar Navigation (Left):** Shows the menu items: **Assets** (currently selected), **Analytics**, **Management**, **Sandbox**, **Inventory**, **Configuration**, and **Audit Log**.

**Dashboard Content (Assets):**
The primary view is the **Assets** dashboard, segmented by tabs: **List View** (active) and **Map View**. Three doughnut charts summarize asset status:

1.  **Tunnel Status (Green):** Title: **Tunnel**. Displays **1 Total** asset. The key indicates **Active** status.
2.  **Firmware Status (Blue):** Title: **Firmware**. Displays **1 Total** asset. The key indicates firmware version **7.4.2**.
3.  **Subscription Status (Red):** Title: **Subscription**. Displays **1 Total** asset. The key indicates **No Subscription**.

Each metric entry (Active, 7.4.2, No Subscription) is followed by the number **1** enclosed in a gray circle (likely indicating the count or a link to the detail view).
images.context: of the page, you’ll see the Region drop-down menu.

images.alt:
The image displays a user interface section titled "**Available Integrations**," listing five distinct software or service integration options presented as clickable tiles in a horizontal row.

**UI Structure and Elements:**

*   **Header:** The section is introduced by the heading "**Available Integrations**."
*   **Tiles:** Five separate tiles are visible, each following a standard format: Vendor Logo/Icon, Product Text Label, and a call-to-action button.
*   **Action Button:** All five tiles feature an identical blue button labeled "**Configure**."
*   **Focus State:** The first tile, FortiGate Cloud, is visually highlighted with a thick orange border, indicating selection or current focus.

**Integration Details (Left to Right):**

1.  **FortiGate Cloud:** Icon of a cloud with internal vertical lines; Text label: "FortiGate Cloud."
2.  **Microsoft Defender for Endpoint:** Icon of a blue shield with a white lightning bolt; Text label: "Microsoft Defender for Endpoint."
3.  **Cloud App Security:** Icon of a cloud connected by a line to a circular node, set against a blue background; Text labels: "Microsoft" and "Cloud App Security."
4.  **Microsoft 365:** Standard multicolored Microsoft logo (four squares); Text label: "Microsoft 365."
5.  **Proofpoint:** Text logo: "proofpoint" (with a small blue arrowhead); No secondary text label.
images.context: ng>FortiGate Cloud card and click Configure.

images.alt:
The interface displayed is the "Security Vendor Integrations" page, with the primary navigation tab "Setup" currently active. A secondary vertical navigation pane highlights "Security Vendor Integrations" and lists configuration sub-links for "User Mapping Setup" and "Delivery Setup."

The main content area is dedicated to the "FortiGate Cloud" integration setup. Instructional text directs users to the "FortiGate Cloud Integration Guide for SecurityCoach" via an external link.

The configuration form requires input for three distinct API credentials:
1. API Domain
2. API ID
3. API Password

Action buttons at the bottom allow the user to proceed with the configuration via the primary "Connect" button or dismiss the configuration via the "Cancel" link. A "← Back to Integrations" link is present in the upper right corner for navigational exit.
images.context: that you saved in the previous section of this article.
